lead_paragraph: Curators and historians take a serious look at tattoos; the Toledo Museum of Art winnows its holdings; and a typewriter collection celebrates low-tech writing.

headline.main: Tattoo History, Antique Typewriters and Letting Go at the Toledo Museum

snippet: Curators and historians take a serious look at tattoos; the Toledo Museum of Art winnows its holdings; and a typewriter collection celebrates low-tech writing.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; Toledo Museum of Art is selling furniture originally commissioned for major arts patrons as it makes room for new acquisitions; Virginia Museum of Fine Arts is preparing exhibition of Japanese tattooing traditions; Paley Center for Media in Los Angeles is displaying two dozen typewriters, all of notorious provenance, from collection of Steve Soboroff, president of city's Police Commission.
